alert.note: Alert for Minnehaha (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:51PM MDT until April 14 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Brookings and Moody Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... South Dakota...Minnesota... Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lyon, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Big Sioux River above Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha and Moody Counties. Big Sioux River near Trent affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Lincoln, Sioux and Union Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Split Rock Creek near Corson affecting Minnehaha County. Rock River at Luverne affecting Rock County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, significant amounts of agricultural lands are flooded through the basin, and the park in Dell Rapids begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM CDT Monday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Big Sioux River Dell Rapids 12.0 13.3 Mon 9 pm 13.0 12.2 11.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
